name: Geophysics BS
overview: The Geophysics major is a designated capstone major. Students are required to use skill and knowledge sets from previous coursework to complete a field-based research project from conception to written report. Projects must be placed into context within the current state of understanding, and results are presented at a research symposium or published as a brief report.

options.title: Introductory Earth Science
options.description: Complete one course: EPS SCI 1, CLUSTER 70A, or any course from Earth, Planetary, and Space Sciences 3 through 17.

requirements.title: Area Requirement
requirements.description: Three additional 100-level Earth, Planetary, and Space Sciences courses are required from the lists below (courses other than M187, 189-199). Students may opt for one of the suggested course groups.

sections.title: Honors Program
sections.description: The honors program in geophysics is intended to provide exceptional students an opportunity for advanced research and study under the tutorial guidance of a faculty member. Honors in geophysics are awarded at graduation to those students who have a cumulative grade-point average of 3.5, have completed at least 90 graded units at the University of California, and have completed the honors thesis requirements. Students demonstrating exceptional ability are awarded highest honors.

requirements.title: Honors Thesis (Optional)
requirements.description: Students must complete a minimum of two terms (8 units) of the following course, leading to the preparation of a satisfactory honors thesis. Qualified students wishing to enter the program must submit a completed application form to the departmental honors committee near the end of their junior year.
